title: High Leverage Point?
question_text: Given the following points on a scatterplot: $(1, 8), (4, 9), (5, 10), (7, 12), (9, 14)$, which of the following points, if included in the scatterplot, is the most likely high leverage point?
solution:
Solution

When examining a scatterplot using linear regression we are looking for a line. When points appear to deviate dramatically from the line we can call them outliers.

Influential points may or may not include outliers. These are points that dramatically change the equation of the regression line if removed. Another type of point which may be an influential point is a high leverage point. This point may not seem as obvious because it could actually lie to the line. What defines this point as high leverage is that its x value is far away from the rest of the points, lower or higher.

In this problem, the x values range from 1 to 9. The only point in the answers with an x value which lies far from this range is (14, 20)$.

So, Choice 'B' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect because this point lies right next to the line, barely outside the x value range.

Choice 'C' is incorrect because, while this point may be an outlier with its high y
value, its x
value is right in the range.

Choice 'D' is incorrect because, while this point may be an outlier with its low y
value, its x
value is right in the range.

Choice 'E' is incorrect because, while this point has the same x
value as one of the given points, and a different y
value, it is still close to being on the line and its x
value is in range.
